prompt: <description>Construction Instructions Part 1: Base of the Prism Construct a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The sides are parallel and the top and bottom faces are perpendicular to the sides. The dimensions of the prism are 3 units in length, 2 units in width, and 1 unit in height. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 2. Draw the 2D sketch for the base of the prism on the x-y plane. a. Create a loop consisting of 4 line segments: - line 1: starting at [0.0, 0.0] and ending at [0.5, 0.0] - line 2: starting at [0.5, 0.0] and ending at [0.5, 0.75] - line 3: starting at [0.5, 0.75] and ending at [0.0, 0.75] - line 4: starting at [0.0, 0.75] and ending at [0.0, 0.0] 3. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by defining the normal using euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. 5. Extrude the 3D sketch with an extrusion depth of 0.3 and a scaling factor of 0.75. Part 2: Tapered Top Prism Create a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.3]. This coordinate system is based on the previous part's final position. 2. Draw the 2D sketch for the tapered prism top on the x-y plane. a. Create a loop consisting of 4 line segments: - line 1: starting at [0.0, 0.0] and ending at [0.15, 0.0] - line 2: starting at [0.15, 0.0] and ending at [0.15, 0.75] - line 3: starting at [0.15, 0.75] and ending at [0.0, 0.75] - line 4: starting at [0.0, 0.75] and ending at [0.0, 0.0] 3. Scale the 2D sketch by 0.75. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by defining the normal using euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.0, 0.0, 0.3]. 5. Extrude the 3D sketch with an extrusion depth of 0.15 towards the opposite normal, and a scaling factor of 0.75, effectively cutting the top part of the prism. Part 3: Central Cylindrical Hole Create a cylindrical object with a tapered end, resembling a metallic tube. 1. Create a new coordinate system with euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector set to [0.225, 0.275, 0.45]. This coordinate system is based on the previous part's final position. 2. Draw the 2D sketch for the cylindrical hole on the x-y plane. a. Create a loop consisting of a circle: - circle 1: centered at [0.1, 0.1] with a radius of 0.1 3. Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.2. 4. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by defining the normal using euler angles [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and translation vector [0.225, 0.275, 0.45]. 5. Extrude the 3D sketch with an extrusion depth of 1.25 towards the opposite normal, and a scaling factor of 0.2, effectively cutting the central cylindrical hole.</description>
completion:
<json>
{"parts":{"part_1":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.0]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.5,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.0],"End Point":[0.5,0.75]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.5,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.75]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.3,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.0,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"NewBodyFeatureOperation"}},"part_2":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.0,0.0,0.3]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"line_1":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.0],"End Point":[0.15,0.0]},"line_2":{"Start Point":[0.15,0.0],"End Point":[0.15,0.75]},"line_3":{"Start Point":[0.15,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.75]},"line_4":{"Start Point":[0.0,0.75],"End Point":[0.0,0.0]}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":0.15,"sketch_scale":0.75,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}},"part_3":{"coordinate_system":{"Euler Angles":[0.0,0.0,0.0],"Translation Vector":[0.225,0.275,0.3]},"sketch":{"face_1":{"loop_1":{"circle_1":{"Center":[0.1,0.1],"Radius":0.1}}}},"extrusion":{"extrude_depth_towards_normal":0.0,"extrude_depth_opposite_normal":1.25,"sketch_scale":0.2,"operation":"CutFeatureOperation"}}}}
</json>

prompt: <description>**CAD Model Creation Instructions** **Part 1: Curved Rectangular Prism** 1. **Create Coordinate System** Create a new coordinate system with euler angles 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 and translation vector 0.0068, 0.0, 0.0. 2. **Create Sketch** On the XY plane of the new coordinate system, create the following sketch: a. **Create Faces** Create two faces: one on the XY plane and the other on the YZ plane. b. **Create Loops** For the face on the XY plane, create a loop consisting of: - (8) arcs. Each arc has a start and end point defined in the CAD assembly JSON. Arc 1 starts at (0.0182, 0.0943), arc 2 ends at (0.7182, 0.0943), arc 3 ends at (0.6126, 0.1529), arc 4 starts at (0.6126, 0.0987), arc 5 ends at (0.1773, 0.1318), arc 6 starts at (0.1773, 0.0987), arc 7 ends at (0.1238, 0.1529), arc 8 starts at (0.1238, 0.0987). For the face on the YZ plane, create a loop consisting of: - A single line connecting (0.1238, 0.1529, 0) and (0.1238, -0.0335, 0). 3. **Create 3D Sketch** Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector defined in the CAD assembly JSON. 4. **Extrude Sketch** Using the extrusion properties defined in the CAD assembly JSON, extrude the 3D sketch into a 3D model. The `operation` parameter is set to `NewBodyFeatureOperation`, indicating the creation of a new solid body. ** dimensions:** - Height: 0.0335 - Width: 0.7364 - Length: 0.7364 This completes the instructions for Part 1 of the CAD model.</description>

<description>**Intermediate Part 1** **Overview** The first part is a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom, and a slightly tapered middle section. The dimensions are approximately 10 units long, 5 units wide, and 2 units high. The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other, and the middle section is slightly narrower than the top and bottom. The sides of the prism are straight and perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. **Coordinate System** Create a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0625, 0.0] **Sketch** Create a new sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system. Face 1: Loop 1: - Arc 1: Start Point [0.0, 0.3], Mid Point [0.0018, 0.2956], End Point [0.0063, 0.2938] - Line 1: Start Point [0.0063, 0.2938], End Point [0.0083, 0.2938] - Arc 2: Start Point [0.0083, 0.2938], Mid Point [0.0128, 0.2919], End Point [0.0146, 0.2875] - Line 2: Start Point [0.0146, 0.2875], End Point [0.0146, 0.0] - Line 3: Start Point [0.0146, 0.0], End Point [0.1312, 0.0] - Line 4: Start Point [0.1312, 0.0], End Point [0.1312, 0.2854] - Arc 3: Start Point [0.1312, 0.2854], Mid Point [0.1331, 0.2898], End Point [0.1375, 0.2917] - Line 5: Start Point [0.1375, 0.2917], End Point [0.1396, 0.2917] - Arc 4: Start Point [0.1396, 0.2917], Mid Point [0.144, 0.2935], End Point [0.1458, 0.2979] - Line 6: Start Point [0.1458, 0.2979], End Point [0.1458, 0.7004] - Arc 5: Start Point [0.1458, 0.7004], Mid Point [0.107, 0.7218], End Point [0.0729, 0.75] - Arc 6: Start Point [0.0729, 0.75], Mid Point [0.0388, 0.7218], End Point [0.0, 0.7004] - Line 7: Start Point [0.0, 0.7004], End Point [0.0, 0.3] **Extrusion** Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis by 0.0625 units. Scale the sketch by a factor of 0.75 before extrusion. The resulting part will have a slightly tapered middle section and will be a rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The dimensions will be approximately 10 units long, 5 units wide, and 2 units high. The operation is a "NewBodyFeatureOperation".</description>

<description>Part 1 Instructions Construct a three-dimensional geometric shape with a hollow center, composed of interconnected rectangular and triangular forms. Coordinate System Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] Sketch Now, create a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system with the following components: Face 1 Face 1 will consist of Loop 1 and Loop 2. Loop 1 Loop 1 is a rectangular shape with 4 lines: * Line 1: Starting Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * Line 2: Starting Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.675] * Line 3: Starting Point [0.75, 0.675], End Point [0.0, 0.675] * Line 4: Starting Point [0.0, 0.675], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Loop 2 Loop 2 is a complex shape with 6 lines: * Line 1: Starting Point [0.0885, 0.3236], End Point [0.2438, 0.0824] * Line 2: Starting Point [0.2438, 0.0824], End Point [0.5303, 0.0963] * Line 3: Starting Point [0.5303, 0.0963], End Point [0.6615, 0.3514] * Line 4: Starting Point [0.6615, 0.3514], End Point [0.5062, 0.5926] * Line 5: Starting Point [0.5062, 0.5926], End Point [0.2197, 0.5787] * Line 6: Starting Point [0.2197, 0.5787], End Point [0.0885, 0.3236] Scaling, Transformation, and Extrusion After creating the sketch, scale it by a factor of 0.75. Then, apply a 3D rotation using the euler angles (0.0, 0.0, 0.0), and translate it using the given translation vector. Next, extrude the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D model, with the following extrusion properties: * Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.375 * Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 * Sketch Scale: 0.75 * Operation: Create a new solid body (without explicitly mentioning "NewBodyFeatureOperation") The final dimensions of this intermediate part are: * Length: 0.75 * Width: 0.75 * Height: 0.375 Congratulations, you've successfully created the first part of the assembly.</description>

prompt: <description>**Part 1: Three-Dimensional Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom** Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: - Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] - Translation Vector: [0.0, 0.25, 0.0] Create a sketch on the X-Y plane of the new coordinate system. The sketch will consist of a single face (face\\_1) with one closed loop (loop\\_1) composed of the following lines and arcs: - line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.25, 0.0] - line\\_2: Start Point [0.25, 0.0], End Point [0.25, 0.25] - line\\_3: Start Point [0.25, 0.25], End Point [0.5, 0.25] - line\\_4: Start Point [0.5, 0.25], End Point [0.5, 0.5] - line\\_5: Start Point [0.5, 0.5], End Point [0.25, 0.5] - line\\_6: Start Point [0.25, 0.5], End Point [0.25, 0.75] - line\\_7: Start Point [0.25, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.75] - line\\_8: Start Point [0.0, 0.75], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Close the loop by connecting line\\_8 to line\\_1. The scaling parameter for the sketch is 0.75. Transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by applying the coordinate system's Euler angles and translation vector. Extrude the 2D sketch along the normal direction to a depth of 0.25 units. This will generate the first intermediate CAD part: a three-dimensional rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The length of this intermediate part is 0.75, the width is 0.25, and the height is 0.75. Move on to creating the next part and follow the same procedure for each part, providing clear and concise instructions contextualized to each part's final shape and dimensions.</description>
